com.vaadin.polymer.vaadin

Interface VaadinGridElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, EventTarget, HTMLElement, Node

    @JsType
public interface VaadinGridElement
extends HTMLElement

    Data grid for showing large amountsos of tabular data.

    Basic usage:

    <vaadin-grid>
   <table>
     <colgroup>
       <col header-text="Name">
       <col header-text="Value">
       <col header-text="Progress">
     </colgroup>
     <tbody>
       <tr>
         <td>Project A</td><td>10000</td><td>0.8</td>
       </tr>
       <tr>
         <td>Project B</td><td>999999</td><td>0.8</td>
       </tr>
     </tbody>
   </table>
 </vaadin-grid>

    More examples available at https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-elements/latest/vaadin-grid/demo/

      • getFrozenColumns

        @JsProperty
double getFrozenColumns()

        The number of frozen columns in this grid. Setting it to 0
        means that no data columns will be frozen, but the built-in selection
        checkbox column will still be frozen if it’s in use. Setting the count to
        -1 will also disable the selection column.

        Attribute: frozen-columns

        JavaScript Info:

      • setFrozenColumns

        @JsProperty
void setFrozenColumns(double value)

        The number of frozen columns in this grid. Setting it to 0
        means that no data columns will be frozen, but the built-in selection
        checkbox column will still be frozen if it’s in use. Setting the count to
        -1 will also disable the selection column.

        Attribute: frozen-columns

        JavaScript Info:

      • getVisibleRows

        @JsProperty
double getVisibleRows()

        The number of visible rows in the grid. Implicitly sets the height
        in the inline style, overriding any previous height. Setting style.height
        in this case should be ignored if possible.

        Attribute: visible-rows

        JavaScript Info:

      • setVisibleRows

        @JsProperty
void setVisibleRows(double value)

        The number of visible rows in the grid. Implicitly sets the height
        in the inline style, overriding any previous height. Setting style.height
        in this case should be ignored if possible.

        Attribute: visible-rows

        JavaScript Info:

      • getItems

        @JsProperty
Object getItems()

        An array or a function containing or returning items determining
        rows in the grid.

        Examples:

         grid.items = [
      ["horse", 150, "domestic"],
      ["wolf", 100, "wild"]
  ];
 
         grid.items = function(params, callback) {
    callback(['foo', 'bar'], 2);
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • getRowDetailsGenerator

        @JsProperty
Function getRowDetailsGenerator()

        The row detail generator that is used for generating detail content for rows.

        Example:

        grid.rowDetails.detailsGenerator = function(rowIndex) {
  var detail = document.createElement('div');
  detail.textContent = 'Row detail content for row ' + rowIndex;
  return detail;
 };
        JavaScript Info:

      • setRowDetailsGenerator

        @JsProperty
void setRowDetailsGenerator(Function value)

        The row detail generator that is used for generating detail content for rows.

        Example:

        grid.rowDetails.detailsGenerator = function(rowIndex) {
  var detail = document.createElement('div');
  detail.textContent = 'Row detail content for row ' + rowIndex;
  return detail;
 };
        JavaScript Info:

      • getCellClassGenerator

        @JsProperty
Function getCellClassGenerator()

        The style generator that is used for generating styles for cells.

        Example:

        grid.cellClassGenerator = function(cell) {
   if (cell.index == 2) {
      var activity = cell.row.data[2];
      return 'activity-' + activity.toLowerCase();
    }
    return '';
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • setCellClassGenerator

        @JsProperty
void setCellClassGenerator(Function value)

        The style generator that is used for generating styles for cells.

        Example:

        grid.cellClassGenerator = function(cell) {
   if (cell.index == 2) {
      var activity = cell.row.data[2];
      return 'activity-' + activity.toLowerCase();
    }
    return '';
  };
        JavaScript Info:

      • getRowClassGenerator

        @JsProperty
Function getRowClassGenerator()

        The style generator that is used for generating styles for rows.

        Example:

        grid.rowClassGenerator = function(row) {
  var activity = row.data[2];
  return 'activity-' + activity.toLowerCase();
 };
        JavaScript Info:

      • scrollToEnd

        VaadinGridElement scrollToEnd()

        Scrolls to the end of the grid.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToEnd().then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

      • scrollToStart

        VaadinGridElement scrollToStart()

        Scrolls to the beginning of the grid.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToStart().then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

      • addColumn

        void addColumn(Column column,
               String beforeColumn)

        Adds a new column. Column is added at the end if beforeColumn is not defined.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {Column} - column
        {string} - beforeColumn

      • getItem

        void getItem(double rowIndex,
             Function callback,
             boolean onlyCached)

        Invokes the callback with row data of the provided row index as the
        parameter. If the row is not cached, it’s fetched from the data source
        first.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {number} - rowIndex
        {Function} - callback
        {boolean} - onlyCached

      • removeColumn

        void removeColumn(String id)

        Removes a column with certain id

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {string} - id

      • then

        com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject then(Function callback)

        Executes a callback when the grid has finished any pending work.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {Function} - callback
        Returns:
        {JavaScriptObject}

      • scrollToRow

        VaadinGridElement scrollToRow(double index,
                              String scrollDestination)

        Scrolls to a certain row, using user-specified scroll destination.

        Scrolling happens asynchronously, so this method returns a ‘thenable’
        which can be used to be notified when the scrolling is finished.

        Example: grid.scrollToRow(10, 'end').then(doMoreStuff);

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {number} - index
        {string} - scrollDestination
        Returns:
        {VaadinGridElement}

      • setRowDetailsVisible

        void setRowDetailsVisible(double rowIndex,
                          boolean visible)

        Shows or hides row details for the row at the given index.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {number} - rowIndex
        {boolean} - visible
